AnimatedNumberScreen.desc: <bold1>AnimatedNumber</bold1> is a component for smooth number animation on screen with support for formatting, currencies, percentages, and signs. Powered by <bold1>react-native-reanimated</bold1> for animated transitions.
AnimatedNumberScreen.features.5: ✅ Fully built with NativeWind and Reanimated
AppearanceScreen.desc: Toggle between light and dark mode
AuthLocal.desc: App is locked. Please authenticate to continue.
ColorPickerScreen.color.label: Colors
ColorPickerScreen.desc: <bold1>ColorPicker</bold1> is a component for selecting from predefined colors. Useful for customizing themes, categories, and any other use case where a color choice is needed. Works with the custom color scheme defined in <bold1>colorsPrimary</bold1>.
ConfirmationDialogScreen.desc.1: <bold1>ConfirmationDialog</bold1> is a simple and user-friendly component for showing a system confirmation dialog. It’s based on <bold1>Alert.alert</bold1> from React Native and is ideal for deletions, logouts, or other critical actions.
ConfirmationDialogScreen.features.2: ✅ Simple API: just title, message, and handlers
CreateNoteFormFieldset.content.label: Content
CreateNoteFormFieldset.title.label: Title (optional)
DateFormatterScreen.desc.1: <bold1>useDateFormatter</bold1> is a hook for formatting dates using the <bold1>en-GB</bold1> locale and optional parameters. It allows rendering date and time in various formats depending on the variant and the <bold1>skipTime</bold1> flag.
DateFormatterScreen.desc.2: It supports two modes: <bold1>variant1</bold1> — full format with date and time (or just the date if <bold1>skipTime</bold1> is used), and <bold1>variant2</bold1> — time only.
DateFormatterScreen.features.4: ✅ Useful for logs, notes, and timestamps
DatePickerScreen.desc.1: <bold1>DatePicker</bold1> is a date selection component with a convenient interface built on top of <bold1>@react-native-community/datetimepicker</bold1> and <bold1>@gorhom/bottom-sheet</bold1>. It allows picking a date within a defined range.
DatePickerScreen.desc.2: The interface is adapted for both iOS and Android: iOS uses a <bold1>spinner</bold1> with a save button, while Android uses the native date picker. The selection happens in a modal BottomSheet.
DatePickerScreen.features.1: ✅ Support for minimum and maximum date
DeleteCategoryButton.confirm.body: If you delete this category ALL related sub-categories and transactions will be also deleted. Make sure you have a backup.
DeleteCategoryButton.confirm.title: Are you sure?
DonutChartScreen.desc.1: <bold1>DonutChart</bold1> is a high-quality custom chart component built on <bold1>react-native-skia</bold1>. It supports animations, gestures, custom fonts, segment selection, and central value display.
DonutChartScreen.desc.2: Chart segments are automatically calculated from percentages with spacing between sectors. Users can tap to select a category — the value will update smoothly in the center of the circle.
DonutChartScreen.features.2: ✅ Custom center text with currency formatting
FaqScreen.itemAnswer1: All transactions are saved directly to your personal Google Sheet. We don’t store any data on our servers — you have full control over your information.
FaqScreen.itemAnswer2:
Yes! You can manually edit or add new rows to the sheet.

⚠️ Please be careful to follow the existing structure of the sheet:

- Use correct column names
- Provide required fields like group ID
- Do not change the format of the existing data

If the structure is broken (e.g., missing group ID), the app may show errors or not work properly.
FaqScreen.itemAnswer3: Yes. We use secure Google authentication. The app only accesses the specific sheet you select and does not have access to your other Google data.
FaqScreen.itemAnswer4: No. The app only works with one spreadsheet, which you choose during the initial setup. Connecting or switching between spreadsheets is not supported and not planned at the moment.
FaqScreen.itemAnswer5:
If you encounter syncing or display issues, try the following:

- Restart the app
- Double-check the structure of your spreadsheet
- Contact our support — we're always happy to help!
FaqScreen.itemQuestion2: 2. Can I manually add transactions to the Google Sheet?

LoginWithEmailScreen.enterCode: Enter the code sent to your email
LoginWithEmailScreen.errorOTP: There was an error sending the code, error: {{message}}
LoginWithEmailScreen.subTitle: Sign in your an account
LoginWithEmailScreen.title: Welcome to NativeLaunch
MoneyFormatterScreen.desc.1: <bold1>useMoneyFormatter</bold1> is a hook for formatting numbers into currency based on locale, ISO currency code, and formatting options. Built on <bold1>Intl.NumberFormat</bold1>, it returns nicely formatted values (e.g., <bold1>$3,999</bold1> or <bold1>$23M</bold1>).
MoneyFormatterScreen.features.1: ✅ Automatic localization based on current language
MoneyFormatterScreen.features.5: ✅ Safe fallback handling for unknown currencies
MonthSelectorScreen.desc.1: <bold1>MonthsSelector</bold1> is a compact month selector component. Built on a custom <bold1>Select</bold1>, it shows the current year and allows users to pick a month in localized format.
MonthSelectorScreen.desc.2: The component automatically calculates <bold1>from / to</bold1> values in ISO format based on the selected month. Supports multilingual UI and custom width adjustments for different languages (e.g. wider layout for Russian).
MonthSelectorScreen.features.2: ✅ Automatic start and end date calculation
MonthYearPickerScreen.desc.1: <bold1>MonthYearPicker</bold1> is a component for selecting month and year, embedded in a modal <bold1>BottomSheet</bold1>. The interface uses native <bold1>Picker</bold1>s, making it intuitive and familiar for both iOS and Android users.
MonthYearPickerScreen.desc.2: The component displays the selected range (start and end of month) and allows choosing any month-year combination within a 20-year span. It supports month localization and color theming through a custom palette.
MonthYearPickerScreen.features.1: ✅ Select month and year via separate pickers
MonthYearPickerScreen.features.2: ✅ Display range in a user-friendly format
MyProfileScreen.areYouSure: Are you sure you want to sign out?
NotFoundScreen.title: This screen doesn't exist.
NoteListGroup.notFound.body: To add first tap add button.
NoteListGroup.notFound.title: You don’t have any notes yet.
NumericPadScreen.desc.1: <bold1>NumericPad</bold1> is a numeric keyboard built specifically for financial apps and number input. It supports numbers, '000', delete, full clear, and max value limits.
NumericPadScreen.desc.2: The <bold1>Backspace</bold1> button deletes one digit and clears the input when held (with haptic feedback via <bold1>expo-haptics</bold1>). The component is Safe Area-aware.
NumericPadScreen.features.3: ✅ Single-digit deletion and full clear on hold
PaywallScreen.growth.option1: Build unlimited projects with no feature limits
PaywallScreen.growth.option2: Access all templates, components, and screens
PaywallScreen.growth.option3: Commercial usage rights for client & production apps
PaywallScreen.growth.option4: Priority support and lifetime updates included
PaywallScreen.paySuccess: Thank you! You have unlocked NativeLaunch Pro!
PaywallScreen.title: Unlock Unlimited Access
RelativeTimeFormatterScreen.desc.1: <bold1>useRelativeTimeFormatter</bold1> is a convenient hook for formatting dates in a relative format (e.g., “today”, “yesterday”, “3 days ago”). It is based on the standard <bold1>Intl.RelativeTimeFormat</bold1> API and automatically calculates the difference in days.
RelativeTimeFormatterScreen.desc.2: The default locale is <bold1>en-GB</bold1>, but it can be easily adapted. The formatted result is returned as a human-readable string without needing custom date comparison logic.
RelativeTimeFormatterScreen.features.1: ✅ Formats dates as “x days ago”, “tomorrow”, etc.
RelativeTimeFormatterScreen.features.4: ✅ Great for lists and activity feeds
RemoveAccountScreen.areYouSure: Are you sure you want to delete your account? This action cannot be undone.
RemoveAccountScreen.success: Your account has been successfully deleted!
RemoveAccountScreen.warningText: Including saved settings. Data in Google Sheets will not be affected.
RemoveAccountScreen.warningTitle: By continuing you delete all personal data from the application.

SettingScreen.share: Hi there! I'm using NativeLaunch to manage my notes. Feel free to give it a try and let me know what you think. https://nativelaunch.com
SheetInfo.bodyText: This is a test sheet to demonstrate how modals work with SheetProvider.
SheetScreen.desc: <bold1>SheetProvider</bold1> wraps your app and provides context for managing modal sheets using <bold1>@gorhom/bottom-sheet</bold1>. This allows opening modals from anywhere in the app.
TextTickerScreen.desc: <bold1>TextTicker</bold1> is a custom component for digit-by-digit number animation. On each value update, digits smoothly "flip", creating a dynamic counter effect. Supports comma formatting, suffixes, and responsive font sizing.
TimeRangeControlScreen.desc.1: <bold1>TimeRangeControl</bold1> is a component for selecting a time range (month or year) using navigation arrows. It allows easy switching between months or years and displays the formatted period.
TimeRangeControlScreen.desc.2: Depending on the provided filter — <bold1>ByMonth</bold1> or <bold1>ByYear</bold1> — the component adjusts its navigation logic and text formatting.
ToastScreen.desc.1: Toast notifications are handled by the <bold1>@backpackapp-io/react-native-toast</bold1> library. It provides a simple API to display error, success, warning, and info messages.
ToastScreen.features.1: ✅ Supports multiple toast types (error, success, info, warning)
ToastScreen.features.4: ✅ Great for errors, confirmations, and statuses
UpdateUserFormFieldset.email.label: Email
UpdateUserFormFieldset.name.label: Full name

WelcomeScreen.slide1.text: Start building your next app instantly with a powerful and well-structured Expo template. Includes built-in navigation, theming, and essential UI components.
WelcomeScreen.slide1.title: Built with the Best
WelcomeScreen.slide2.text: Tailor your app’s look with light and dark themes, prebuilt UI blocks, and full NativeWind styling. No need to start from scratch.
WelcomeScreen.slide2.title: Customizable UI
WelcomeScreen.slide3.desc: Includes everything you need to launch fast: auth, localization, paywall, error handling, deep linking, dark mode, and OTA updates — all set up and production-ready.
WelcomeScreen.slide3.title: Ready for Production
